messages.subject: Re: unschool childcare business & Living History Workshops
messages.msgSnippet: Good morning, Thank you both for your input.  I ll brainstorm to see if I can come up with a home-based business I might enjoy.  I am a writer; maybe I ll
messages.messageBody:
Good morning,

Thank you both for your input. I'll brainstorm to see if I can come
up with a home-based business I might enjoy. I am a writer; maybe
I'll start there. I also thought about creating Living History
Workshops. I love History and think I can come up with some kind of
fun 1/2 for kids that would be entertaining and fun, something like
a day in the life of a pioneer. Any thoughts on that?
Ren, your absolutely right about taking on too much. I really would
have to find the right mixture of kids. Thanks for all your help.
Peace & Blessings,
Sandra

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Ren Allen"
<starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> " I would provide a safe
> place for their children to be while they worked. "
>
> I would love a place like this. I know many other home/unschoolers
> would be thrilled to find a parent to help them out. Advertise with
> local support groups, you might be surprised by how many calls you
get.
>
> Just be realistic in what you take on. Even ONE extra child takes
time
> and energy away from your own children. The right mix of kids
could be
> a great thing though.
>
> Ren
> learninginfreedom.com
>

messages.subject: unschool childcare
messages.msgSnippet: I would provide a safe place for their children to be while they worked.  I would love a place like this. I know many other home/unschoolers would be
messages.messageBody:
" I would provide a safe
place for their children to be while they worked. "

I would love a place like this. I know many other home/unschoolers
would be thrilled to find a parent to help them out. Advertise with
local support groups, you might be surprised by how many calls you get.

Just be realistic in what you take on. Even ONE extra child takes time
and energy away from your own children. The right mix of kids could be
a great thing though.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
